Jekyll Variables

an overview of Jekyll variables

An overview of using variables within Jekyll. This data is available using the Liquid templating engine.

Contents
Introduction
Global
Site
Page

Introduction

Jekyll uses the Liquid template engine to access data within global, site, page, and paginator. Further information can be found in the Jekyll Documentation

Global

There are four global variables for use with Jekyll,

  • site
  • page
  • content
  • paginator

Each of the above can be extended with options to enable more detailed retrieval of site data and information.

Site

The site variable allows us to retrieve data related to pages, posts, static files, html pages, collections etc.

Page

The page variable enables us to drill down through page titles, metadata, categories, tags etc.
